div.em: Current conditions as of 22 Apr 10:15 am CDT

div.div: Showers and possibly a thunderstorm before 1pm, then showers and thunderstorms after 1pm. Some of the storms could produce heavy rainfall. High near 69. Southeast wind 15 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches possible.

Showers and thunderstorms likely, mainly before 1am. Cloudy, with a low around 55. South wind 5 to 15 mph becoming northwest after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.
Cloudy through mid morning, then gradual clearing, with a high near 73. Northwest wind 10 to 15 mph.

div.div: Your session will expire in 0 minutes.

div.h3: Woodall District's Response and Updates to COVID-19

span.a: Letter to Parents from Mrs. Clinkenbeard 3-17-2020

p.strong:
Woodall Families,
As we have mentioned in previous communication, we will start our continuous learning plan on Monday, April 6, 2020 and will continue the plan until our last day of school on May 8, 2020. Our 6th-8th grade students will complete lessons online with their school issued laptops. PK-5th grade students will complete blended lessons both online and with paper packets. Our teachers have spent the last week preparing lessons and materials for our students.
We will have a learning material distribution on Monday, April 6th. All materials needed for the rest of the school year will be distributed on this day. No learning materials will come back to the school during this time. If we are currently delivering meals to your family, we will also deliver your child’s learning materials on Monday. If you currently pick up meals at the school from 9:00-11:00, you will pick up your child’s learning materials on Monday, during this time. All other students will need to pick up learning materials at the school on Monday between 11:00-3:00.
You will drive on to campus through the gate, drive down alley way, around back of buildings, and pull up by the side door of the old gym. Your child’s learning materials will be brought to your car. No need to get out of your vehicle.
If a 6th-8th grade student needs an essential item from their locker, we can get it for you at this time. Otherwise, lockers may be cleaned out by students when our buildings are opened back up to students.
Lesson plans for all grades will be posted weekly on our website www.woodall.k12.ok.us under the Distance Learning tab. Parents and students will need to review the plans daily for assignments. Your child’s teacher will be in communication with you about assignments. If you do not hear from your child’s teacher and you have questions, please email them at the email address found in the staff directory on our website.
Remember, it is Woodall Public Schools’ goal to not only provide essential learning opportunities for your children, but also provide structure and routine surrounding those learning moments. If you have any questions, or you cannot pick up materials on Monday, please email me at gknight@woodall.k12.ok.us and I will arrange an alternative time with you.
We miss you all and hope everyone is staying safe!
Take care, Mrs. Knight
